channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In North Macedonia, Officials Investigate Lapses in Deadly Nightclub Fire
item.description: At least 59 people died and more than 150 were injured in the inferno. The authorities said the venue’s hospitality permit had been issued illegally.

item.title: Harvard Will Make Tuition Free for More Students
item.description: Harvard is the latest elite school to announce that families with incomes of $200,000 and under will not pay tuition as a way to bolster diversity.

item.title: The Republicans Pushing Trump to Save Biden’s Clean Energy Tax Credits
item.description: Despite President Trump’s rollback of climate policy, some Republicans and business leaders say clean energy can help his “energy dominance” agenda.

item.title: Netanyahu’s Move to Fire Shin Bet Chief Reflects Wider Push for Control
item.description: The effort is part of a dispute between Benjamin Netanyahu’s right-wing alliance and its opponents about the nature and future of the Israeli state.

item.title: In Ukraine’s Frontline Town of Sloviansk, a Taste of Normalcy Beckons
item.description: Sushi has long been a popular indulgence in Ukraine. For the residents of Sloviansk, a city in Russian cross hairs, it can provide a sense of normalcy...

item.title: Kremlin Stays Mum on Agenda for Putin’s Call With Trump
item.description: The call, scheduled for Tuesday, will be the first known conversation between the two leaders since Mr. Putin laid out numerous conditions for a cease...

item.title: Teslas are getting torched in Berlin as surveys show Germans are deserting Elon Musk’s carmaker in droves
item.description: Surveys conducted by Caliber and T-Online both show a sharp drop in favorability for Tesla among Germans.

item.title: Netanyahu’s Move to Fire Shin Bet Chief Reflects Wider Push for Control
item.description: The effort is part of a dispute between Benjamin Netanyahu’s right-wing alliance and its opponents about the nature and future of the Israeli state.

item.title: BYD unveils battery system that charges EVs in five minutes
item.description: The speeds would be comfortably ahead of Tesla’s Superchargers, which can add up to 275 kilometers of range in 15 minutes.

item.title: American Eagle’s CEO notes a psychological shift with Gen Z shoppers—and it’s fueled by economic anxiety
item.description: U.S. shoppers stepped up their spending just a bit in February after a sharp pullback the previous month, signaling that Americans are shopping more c...

item.title: Warren Buffett once offered $1 billion to any Berkshire Hathaway employee who could pick a perfect March Madness bracket. What to know about college basketball’s biggest tournament
item.description: The college basketball season is winding down, which means March Madness is upon us.

item.title: A Special St. Patrick’s Day Guest: the Head of King George V
item.description: At its show in Australia this weekend, the raucously political rap trio Kneecap brought what appeared to be the missing head of a King George V statue...

item.title: The Women Most Affected by Abortion Bans
item.description: After the Dobbs decision, births rose in states with bans, but more for some women than others.

item.title: Trump Administration Revives Detention of Immigrant Families
item.description: Two facilities in South Texas are being readied for undocumented parents and their children. One site began receiving them earlier this month.

item.title: I’ve seen companies fail for want of honest feedback. Here’s how to build a culture of candor
item.description: Our ability to give and receive honest feedback may determine our professional success—and more.
